history.content: I guess if you are enrolled as a masters student you probably can't finish the math major "officially" anymore, but why does that matter? If you are interested in math, and staying in Berkeley another year, I would say to go for it and enroll in the remaining math classes you have left. No one is stopping you from taking as many classes and learning as much as you want when you're at Cal. Remember, it's what you learn that matters, and especially if you're doing research in your Master's that may benefit from a stronger math background.

children.subject:
I completely understand the fact of wanting to have two majors on the diploma.

I believe it's possible if you have not yet receive your diploma, you can request an additional semester at Cal to complete your applied math while enrolled in the fifth year master in CS. However, that is under the condition that you have not yet dropped Applied Math on your calcentral yet. (You can't redeclare major)

You should contact an advisor upon the detail of the process!

history.content: I worked on an applied math major but decided to terminate pursuing the major eventually. I graduated with a bachelor's degree in CS at the end of this spring, but just out of curiosity, is it possible to finish the applied math major in the upcoming fall semester? I am returning to school for EECS fifth year MS program, so have the option to take one remaining math class I need to in order to complete the major but I'm not a bachelor's student anymore (but I read somewhere that double majors can finish their degrees using 9 semesters)
history.subject: 5th Year MS and finishing another bachelor's degree
